title: How to Eat Sardines

steps.headline: Bake your sardines with herbs.
steps.description: Add your sardines to a warm, oven-safe dish and sprinkle them with fresh herbs. Fresh parsley and some black pepper taste great with sardines. Cook your sardines at 500 °F (260 °C) for six minutes before removing them from the oven. You can eat baked sardines on their own or add them to dishes like eggs or pastas.

steps.headline: Broil your sardines.
steps.description: Place sardines in a baking dish and season them with your choice of spices, herbs, oils, or things like lemon juice. Place them under your oven's broiler and let them cook for two to three minutes. Broiled sardines can be eaten on their own or mixed into seasoned vegetables.

steps.headline: Grill your sardines.
steps.description: Add a little bit of butter or olive oil to a skillet. Add your sardines to your skillet and grill them over medium heat for two to three minutes until they're charred on one side. Then, flip the sardines over and repeat on the other side.

steps.headline: Add sardines to pizza.
steps.description: Sardines can make a great pizza topping. If you're making a pizza at home, add a few sardines onto the crust after you add the tomato sauce and cheese. Pop your pizza in the oven for the regular cooking time and then enjoy a slice of pizza with an added seafood flavor.

steps.headline: Top salads with sardines.
steps.description: A salad can become a great meal for lunch with the addition of sardines. Sardines add extra protein to a salad and a little extra taste. You can add cooked sardines to a salad or add them straight from the can.

steps.headline: Add sardines to a tomato-based sauce.
steps.description: Sardines pair well with tomato. If you're making a sauce, toss the sardines in while it's simmering. This adds extra protein to a pasta dish and adds a tasty fish flavor to your meal.

steps.headline: Serve sardines between toast as a sandwich.
steps.description: For a quick breakfast or snack, add a couple of sardines to a piece of toast. You can top the sardines with salt and pepper for a savory treat. Add an egg on top of the sardines and place another piece of toast on top to make a sandwich. Try adding a savory spread, like hummus, to your toast and then topping it with sardines.

steps.headline: Make pate with sardines.
steps.description: Place two cans of sardines, seven ounces of cottage cheese, seven ounces of Greek yogurt, and the juice from half a lemon into a food processor. Turn the food processor on and mix until you have a fine paste. You can serve this on crackers or bread for a quick, savory snack.

steps.headline: Eat sardines on their own straight from the can.
steps.description: You don't have to cook sardines to enjoy them. You can open a can and simply eat the sardines on their own. This can be a quick snack on the go.

steps.headline: Top crackers with sardines.
steps.description: Sardines and crackers can be a quick and easy snack. Simply cut some sardines into small pieces and use them as a topping on your favorite cracker. For added taste, combine the sardines with a bit of cheese.
